intro: Ricinocarpus australis, commonly known as the Australian ricin olive, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and smooth, dark green leaves. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that contain toxic seeds, which are a key feature in its botanical classification. It thrives in coastal and sandy soils, often found in heathlands and open forests. Due to its toxic properties, it is important to handle the plant with care.
